outputs.output_descr:
The DLG key outputs are as follows:
Institutional and Human capacity building for effective service delivery: Focus on National Technical Team, Provincial and Municipal Technical teams training, mentor and coaching for effective use of the methods and manuals appropriate to their areas of responsibility. In support of the capacity building the focus will is on: (i) Programmatic Aspects, and (ii) Operational Aspects.
Planning and Budgeting: Focus on elaboration of municipal profiles, were introduced technical tools for participatory diagnosis (Rural Rapid Appraisal) for information gathering and systematization - (SWOT Analysis), complemented by other instruments and models of programming such as Territorial planning techniques. It includes the annual programming and budgeting process and methodological instruments for integrated municipal prioritization and implementation, monitoring and evaluation of development planning.
Fiscal decentralization and public finance management: Focus on management platform for accounting, finances and internal control, patrimonial management and human resource management and infrastructure Project management. UNDP support includes decentralisation of public financial management systems and delegation of authority from the central to provincial governments and selected municipal authorities.

Gender and Participatory Mechanisms: It aims at mainstreaming gender issues, at achieving the following: (i) engendering the planning process through the dissemination of gender analysis tools, instruments for gender planning and budgeting, foster the participation of women and marginalized groups in the planning; (ii) increasing the active participation of women in decision making at local levels (province, Municipalities, communes and settlements), through review and engendering of participatory mechanisms and making participation a more effective channel for the expression of marginalized people's demands

Local Economic Development: Build partnerships and linkages between local governments and local communities (associations, cooperatives in view to promote rural small and medium enterprises  Private/Community & Public Partnership).

The Project seeks to support the selected municipalities, by motivating local communities and civil society to demand better services and to contribute to the delivery of those services, and also stimulating sustainable local development. The approach recognizes CSOs as key partners in governance and development, and emphasizes the strengthening of linkages to improve citizens' participation and community mobilization, the identification of priorities in development, contributions from local knowledge bases, and stimulate community driven local development processes towards poverty alleviation efforts. From a decentralization point of view, strengthening local communities through CSO empowerment is the most feasible way to enhance constructive inclusive local economic development, with multi effects at rural level (employment generation, source of income).

project_descr: The objective of the programme is to promote service delivery, socio-economic development and poverty reduction through improved decentralized governance and institutional capacity building at provincial and municipal level.
